translated: Birth Stories
The Fives🔽The Chapter with Short (Stories) about Jewellery
The Shorter Story of Dhammapāla the Potter
“I alone am the one who is to blame,
for the king’s great crime;
Let him release Dhammapāla,
and cut off my hands, your majesty.
I alone am the one who is to blame,
for the king’s great crime;
Let him release Dhammapāla,
and cut off my feet, your majesty.
I alone am the one who is to blame,
for the king’s great crime;
Let him release Dhammapāla,
and cut off my head, your majesty.
Surely this king has no friends
or well-wishers at all,
who do not tell the king:
‘Do not kill your own son.’
Surely this king has no relatives
or well-wishers at all,
who do not tell the king:
‘Do not kill your own son.’🔽The arms of Dhammapāla, anointed with sandalwood paste,
are being cut off,
the heir to the throne;
my life is ebbing away, your majesty.”
The Shorter Story of Dhammapāla the Potter, the eighth.
